p: It is important to note the dissimilar interpretations of how neoliberal economics, the foundational base of the climate regime, looks at adaptation. One group argues that given the direct climate change impacts and adaptation benefits being local, national, or at best regional, adaptation does not constitute a GPG (Zedillo 2008), presenting a less compelling case for global cooperation. Further, adaptation concerns present a poor case for market instruments (Driesen 2009). These ideas draw their strength from Article 3.3 of the UNFCCC, cited above.
